channel.title: Help With NPCS!
channel.description:
How do i make it so I can spawn npcs that you cant fight. I want them to say things like "Welcome to chrisscape!" and I want to make it so they respawn and how to place them.
Thsi is not the same question as the question I posted on the other post

item.title: Help With NPCS!
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“kniveslives, post:4, topic:151847”]You don’t know how to place them? If not, there should be a file in your source called “Autospawn.Cfg” open that with Notepad, then find the NPC’s ID and choose where you want it to spawn, with the X and Y Coordinates. After that, you should have a file called NPCHandler, look for the NPC you chose in there, using his ID, so hit Control F and type in his ID, it should come up, now I will show you what mine looks like for a better example:

				if (npcs[i].npcType == 1201) {
					if (misc.random2(30) == 1) {
						npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
						npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
						npcs[i].textUpdate = "Welcome to Kniveslives.no-ip.org!";
					}
				}

The Welcome to Kniveslives.no-ip.org! Is the area you type in what you want it to say. If your NPC doesn’t have a spot in here, either choose a new NPC or attempt to add it in, but I don’t know how adding it in will have an affect, but you can try it. Anyway, good luck, Chris :)[/quote]

Dude before you type it know what your talking about…
Go to NpcHandler.java and it like that…

Read full topic

item.title: Help With NPCS!
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

[quote=“chris1231112, post:5, topic:151847”]When I go to autospawn it has something after the xy coordinates. like this

spawn = 132 2669 9179 1 2744 9150 2693[/quote]

Lol, the monkey. Anyway, I’m not sure what those are for, try it without changing them, if that doesn’t work, then I guess wait for someone else to reply, I’ve never changed them, I’ve only moved the Shop Keeper in Varrock to another place in Varrock, so I’m not sure if that matters or not. But I do know that the NPCHandler stuff works, I did that earlier and it was successful.

Read full topic

item.title: Help With NPCS!
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

You don’t know how to place them? If not, there should be a file in your source called “Autospawn.Cfg” open that with Notepad, then find the NPC’s ID and choose where you want it to spawn, with the X and Y Coordinates. After that, you should have a file called NPCHandler, look for the NPC you chose in there, using his ID, so hit Control F and type in his ID, it should come up, now I will show you what mine looks like for a better example:

				if (npcs[i].npcType == 1201) {
					if (misc.random2(30) == 1) {
						npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
						npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
						npcs[i].textUpdate = "Welcome to Kniveslives.no-ip.org!";
					}
				}

The Welcome to Kniveslives.no-ip.org! Is the area you type in what you want it to say. If your NPC doesn’t have a spot in here, either choose a new NPC or attempt to add it in, but I don’t know how adding it in will have an affect, but you can try it. Anyway, good luck, Chris

Read full topic
